result.execSummary:
The defendant Demetri L Scott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery with Threat of Force, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Attempt Attempt Armed Robbery with Threat of Force, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $19.00 to John D.  Joint and several with codefendant on this case Reaquan Maniece.

EACH COUNT:  Court costs and victim witness surcharges, DNA surcharge.
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:   are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds. Balance to be paid during term of Extended Supervision. Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count two, but consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit for 150 days.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full time, defendant to have a part time job.  Obtain GED or HSED.  Vocational needs/programs.
Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No association wit drug users, drug dealers and drug houses.
No contact with Christopher H., Nico B. and John D.
No alcohol or controlled substances.

Cooperate with agent.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment. Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample, pay related surcharge.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Robert Lee Taylor in court, defendant Demetri L Scott not in court, in custody.  Kenneth Olstinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Both parties appear via Zoom video.
Defense counsel waives defendant's appearance for purposes of this hearing.
Parties in court to review the findings of the doctor's report.
Defense counsel advises Court he has not yet reviewed the report with the defendant but stipulates that the defendant will not challenge the findings of the doctor's report.
State is not challenging the findings of the doctor's report.
Defense counsel is not challenging the findings of the doctor's report.

There being no challenge to the report, Court adopts the professional opinion of the examiner's that the defendant does not lack substantial capacity to understand the proceedings or aid in his defense.  Court finds the defendant competent and reinstates the proceedings.  
Case is referred back to the Division of Hearings and Appeals.

No futher court date scheduled.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Demetri L Scott in court with attorney Laurence M Moon.  Defendant Demetri L Scott in custody.  Jeremy Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by State, Defense and Defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 6 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 1/2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 1/2 YEARS, concurrent with COUNT 2 but consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 150 days time served.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution in the amount of $19.00 joint/several with co-defendant on this case, Reaquan Maniece, to John D, to be collected out of 25% of prison funds and during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses
-Cooperate with agent
-Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job 
-Obtain GED or HSED
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-No contact with Christopher H, Nico B and John D.
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Vocational needs/programs

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

AS TO COUNT 2:

The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 2 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of  1 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 YEARS, concurrent with COUNT 1 but consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 150 days time served.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution in the amount of $19.00 joint/several to John D.
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses
-Cooperate with agent
-Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job 
-Obtain GED or HSED
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-No contact with Christopher H, Nico B and John D.
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Vocational needs/programs

Criminal Complaint and Information on Read-In Case 14CF317 scanned to this case for the purpose of electronic transfer to Department of Corrections.

Defendant Demetri L Scott in court with attorney Laurence M Moon.  Defendant Demetri L Scott in custody.  
Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

AS TO BOTH COUNTS:  The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.   Defense request for presentence investigation granted.  On state's motion, the Court orders the defendant REMANDED into custody pending sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Demetri I Scott in court with attorney Laurence M Moon.  Defendant Demetri I Scott in custody.  
Megan Patricia Carmody for Jeremy Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Return on Doctor's Report Return.  Hearing proceeded.  

Parties in receipt of report authored by Deborah L. Collins, Psy.D.  There being no challenge to the report dated 6-06-15 by the state, defense counsel or defendant, the court found the defendant competent to proceed and ordered the proceedings reinstated.  Defense request to argue bail granted.  Bail argument made by defense followed by the state.  Defense bail motion denied; bail to remain as set prior to proceedings being suspended.  Defendant reordered (tot) to Justice Point for Supervision.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  Filed, Pretrial Release Conditions Order.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Laurence M Moon in court, defendant Demetri L Scott not in court, in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Doctor's Report Return.  Case passed to allow defense time to review the report with defendant.  Defense prepared to proceed.  Branch 21 in jury trial and unable to hear this matter on today; adjourned date selected.  Defense requests to address bail on the next date.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Report dated 3-06-15 authored by Deborah L. Collins, Psy. D., received and filed.
Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services, signed and filed.

Attorney Laurence M Moon in court, defendant Demetri L Scott not in court, in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Scheduling conference.  Appearance of the defendant waived for the purpose of today's proceedings.  Court is advised by defense counsel that there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  The court suspended the proceedings and ordered the defendant be examined by the Department of Health Services.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for March 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Laurence M Moon in court, defendant Demetri L Scott not in court, in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Scheduling conference.  The defendant has another case pending before Branch 21 set on tomorrow.  This case adjourned until 2-17-15 at 8:30 a.m. before Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Demetri L Scott in court with attorney Laurence M Moon.  Defendant Demetri L Scott in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with 1600 and 1700 BLOCKS OF NORTH WARREN; 1300 BLOCK OF E. BRADY ST.; NICO B., GABRIEL S., CHRIS C. AND CHRISTOPHER H.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Demetri L Scott in court with Student Intern STEPHANIE THOMAS under the supervision of attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Demetri L Scott in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge BRASH, Branch 21.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
